name: YeungWiki
body:
### Recent News

Jul' 14: Lead a team project with David Younger and Ania Baetica in a 2014 DARPA TXTL Workshop on genetic context.

Jul' 14: Paper accepted for the 2014 CDC [1](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~murray/preprints/yeu+14-cdc_s.pdf).

Feb '14: Submitted to the 2014 Winter q-Bio Conference [1](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~murray/papers/2013l_guo+14-wqbio.html), [2](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~murray/papers/2013l_qkym14-wqbio.html), [3](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~murray/preprints/ygm14-wqbio_s.pdf)

Aug '13: Taught a track in the [2014 DARPA TXTL Workshop](https://www.cds.caltech.edu/~murray/wiki/TX-TL_Workshop,_Aug_2013:_Detailed_Schedule TX-TL workshop). 

Dec '13: Presented two papers in Italy at the IEEE CDC.   [1](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~ehyeung/Wiki/CDC13CME.pdf)  [2](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~ehyeung/Wiki/CDC13NMP.pdf)

Mar '12: Submitted a paper to the 2012 IEEE CDC [1](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~ehyeung/Wiki/images/7/70/CDC12.pdf)


### Brief Bio

I received my B.S. in Mathematics, magna cum laude and with University Honors, in 2010 from Brigham Young University. While at BYU, I was fortunate to receive a College of Physical and Mathematical Sciences Choose to Give Scholarship, [IDeA Labs](http://idealabs.byu.edu) Research Fellowship and an Office of Research and Creative Arts (ORCA) Grant to study network modeling, reduction, and representation problems with [Dr. Sean Warnick](https://cs.byu.edu/faculty/warnick_sean).   I also have had the privilege of working with [Dr. Sandip Roy](https://eecs.wsu.edu/~sroy), director of the Dynamical Networks Group at Washington State University, [Dr. Jorge Goncalves](http://www-control.eng.cam.ac.uk/~jmg77) in the Control Group at Cambridge University, and [Dr. Henrik Sandberg](http://www.ee.kth.se/~hsan/) at the Royal Institute of Technology.   

I am currently at the California Institute of Technology, pursuing a Ph.D in Control and Dynamical Systems on a Charles Lee Powell Foundation Fellowship. I am working with professor [Richard Murray](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~murray). Throughout my PhD, I have been supported generously by a National Defense and Science Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowship, a Charles Lee Powell Foundation Fellowship, and a Kanel Foundation Fellowship. 


[Curriculum Vitae](http://www.cds.caltech.edu/~eyeung/CV.pdf)
